Method Detail

hasError

public static boolean hasError(Topology top)
check if topology has any validation error

Parameters:
topology - a topology object
Returns:
boolean true, if error found

getUnitInTopology

public static Unit getUnitInTopology(Unit input,
                                     Topology topToHuntIn)
Find a copy of a unit in a different topology. This works only if the unit has been copied from one topology to the other.

Parameters:
input - the unit
topToHuntIn - the topology to search in
Returns:
the unit in the topology if it exists, null otherwise

sequenceTopologyHostingStack

public static java.util.Map sequenceTopologyHostingStack(Topology top)
Sequence the units with-in the the topology based on the hosting stack. A map is created from a list of non hosted units to the hostee stack. This ordering can then be used by the exporters or publishers.

Parameters:
top - the topology to traverse
Returns:
the map of the installed host unit to the hostee list

importTopology

public static Import importTopology(Topology importTopology,
                                    Topology targetTopology)
Imports a topology into another topology.

Creates or reuses an Import on Topology.getImports().

Parameters:
importTopology - the topology to be imported.
targetTopology - the topology where the Import will be added.
Returns:
the existing or newly created Import.

resolve

public static Topology resolve(Import importDcl)
Resolve a topology import to its topology.

Parameters:
importDcl - a topology import.
Returns:
the topology object, or null if it cannot be resolved.

getAllImportedTopologies

public static java.util.List getAllImportedTopologies(Topology top)
Returns all the topologies imported by a topology (recursive).

The returned list does not include the topology argument. The method will return even if there is a cycle in the import graph.

Parameters:
top - a deploy topology.
Returns:
List of all topologies imported directly or indirectly by the topology.

getAllImportedTopologies

public static java.util.List getAllImportedTopologies(Topology top,
                                                      boolean includeTopology)
Returns all the topologies imported by a topology (recursive).

The returned list does not include the topology argument. The method will return even if there is a cycle in the import graph.

Parameters:
top - a deploy topology.
includeTopology - true if the topology should be included in the list.
Returns:
List of all topologies imported directly or indirectly by the topology.

getImmediateHostingLinksIn

public static java.util.List<HostingLink> getImmediateHostingLinksIn(Unit hosted)
Returns a list of hosting links whose target is the specified unit.

Queries hosting links contained in Unit.getHostingLinks() as well as Topology.getHostingLinks().

In hosting links, the target is the hosted unit, and the source is the host.

Note: in a valid model, the list size will be 0 or 1. However, it is possible that lists of size greater than 1 will be returned for invalid models.

Parameters:
hosted - a topology unit that is the target of zero or more hosting links.
Returns:
an immutable list of hosting links whose UnitLink.getTarget() is the unit.

getImmediateHostingLinksOut

public static java.util.List<HostingLink> getImmediateHostingLinksOut(Unit host)
Returns a list of hosting links whose source is the specified unit.

Queries hosting links contained in Unit.getHostingLinks() as well as Topology.getHostingLinks().

In hosting links, the target is the hosted unit, and the source is the host.

Parameters:
host - a topology unit that is the source of zero or more hosting links.
Returns:
an immutable list of hosting links whose UnitLink.getSource() is the unit.

getImmediateMemberLinksIn

public static java.util.List<MemberLink> getImmediateMemberLinksIn(Unit member)
Returns a list of member links whose target is the specified unit.

Queries member links contained in Unit.getMemberLinks() as well as Topology.getMemberLinks().

In member links, the target is the member unit, and the source is the group.

Parameters:
member - a topology member unit.
Returns:
an immutable list of member links whose UnitLink.getTarget() is the unit.

getImmediateMemberLinksOut

public static java.util.List<MemberLink> getImmediateMemberLinksOut(Unit group)
Returns a list of member links whose source is the specified unit.

Queries member links contained in Unit.getMemberLinks() as well as Topology.getMemberLinks().

In member links, the target is the member unit, and the source is the group.

Parameters:
group - a topology group unit.
Returns:
an immutable list of member links whose UnitLink.getSource() is the unit.

getImmediateDependencyLinksIn

public static java.util.List<DependencyLink> getImmediateDependencyLinksIn(Capability cap)
Returns a list of dependency links whose target is the specified capability.

Queries dependency links contained in Requirement.getLink() as well as Topology.getDependencyLinks().

In dependency links, the target is a capabiilty, and the source is a requirement.

Parameters:
cap - a topology unit capability.
Returns:
an immutable list of dependency links whose DependencyLink.getTarget() is the capability.

getImmediateDependencyLinksOut

public static java.util.List<DependencyLink> getImmediateDependencyLinksOut(Requirement req)
Returns a list of dependency links whose source is the specified requirement.

Queries dependency links contained in Requirement.getLink() as well as Topology.getDependencyLinks().

In dependency links, the target is a capability, and the source is a requirement.

Returns all links, including those whose source or target is going to be uninstalled.

Parameters:
req - a topology unit requirement.
Returns:
an immutable list of dependency links whose DependencyLink.getTarget() is the unit.

getImmediateDependencyLinksOut

public static java.util.List<DependencyLink> getImmediateDependencyLinksOut(Requirement req,
                                                                            boolean includeNotInstalledLinks)
Returns a list of dependency links whose source is the specified requirement.

Queries dependency links contained in Requirement.getLink() as well as Topology.getDependencyLinks().

In dependency links, the target is a capability, and the source is a requirement .

Parameters:
req - a topology unit requirement.
includeNotInstalledLinks - true if links whose target or source are uninstalled should be returned.
Returns:
an immutable list of dependency links whose DependencyLink.getSource() is the requirement

Queries logical links contained in Unit.getConstraintLinks() well as Topology.getConstraintLinks().

Returns all links, including those whose source or target is going to be uninstalled.

Parameters:
source - a topology object.
Returns:
an immutable list of logical links whose ConstraintLink.getSource() is the object.
